command: $target='203.0.113.25'; $seq=@(1111,2222,3333); foreach($p in $seq){ Test-NetConnection -ComputerName $target -Port $p -InformationLevel Quiet | Out-Null; Start-Sleep -Milliseconds 400 }; Test-NetConnection -ComputerName $target -Port 8443 -InformationLevel Detailed
explanation: Sends a TCP port-knocking sequence (1111, 2222, 3333) to signal a hidden service to open 8443. Detection: correlate multiple failed connection attempts to closed ports followed by a successful connection to a previously closed port; monitor Windows Firewall/WFP logs (e.g., Event IDs 5157/5156) and NetFlow for short-interval sequential connection attempts.
rationale_steps: Send short-spaced TCP connect attempts to a specific sequence of ports to act as the knock.
Attempt final connection to the hidden service port expected to open upon correct knock.
Defenders: alert on sequential failed connection attempts to uncommon ports followed by success on a new port; inspect WFP/Firewall and NetFlow logs.
